A more flexible way to address this is to use a scripting language.

TestNG=
 allows you to define such clauses in BeanShell, so that, for example,
if y=
ou want certain tests to run on weekends only, you would use the
following =
code:

<test name=3D"Basic" >
  <script language=3D"beanshell"><![CDATA[
  =
   int today =3D Calendar.getInstance().
       get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK);
=
    return today =3D=3D Calendar.SATURDAY ||
               today =3D=3D Ca=
lendar.SUNDAY;
  ]]></script>=0B

You can also do more fun stuff, like aski=
ng the user if they wish to run
each test method with a Swing dialog (more =
details
here<http://beust.com/weblog/archives/000325.html>
).

BeanShell is=
 very cool and very simple to integrate in your applications, I
strongly re=
commend using it instead of reinventing your own expression
language.

-- 
=
Cedric
